message.content:
cs.CL, cs.CR, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper discusses stylometry and author obfuscation, which are topics related to natural language processing and machine learning. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves privacy and security concerns, which could fall under cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The use of metrics and transformations suggests a focus on information retrieval, which could be categorized under cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The approach proposed in the paper involves adjusting metrics towards average levels, which could be considered a form of regularization, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a possible sub-category. Finally, the use of automatic tools and random noise suggests a focus on artificial intelligence, which could fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
